Reception_CorpseTender.synopsis: A nurse is tending to the corpse of Arabella's father, one of the rejected/failed experiments of the Surgeon. She is insistent that it makes sense, even though the corpse is well... a corpse. The player can trade with this nurse.
Reception_CorpseTender.how_to_trigger: In the hospital in the shadow cursed town, interact with the nurse in the children's ward who is tending a corpse

ZealousAssistant_001_AD.synopsis: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.

AD_Surgeon.synopsis: Surgeon in the Hospital in the Cursed Town operates on a goblin restrained in a chair.OR comments about patients if the goblin is dead (released).

PAD_Entrance_1P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Hospital in SCL

ZealousAssistant_000.synopsis: One of the nurses in the Hospital
ZealousAssistant_000.how_to_trigger: Convince the Surgeon to be operated by the nurses. Talk to them after.

ZealousAssistant_000_AD.synopsis: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.

Reception_Receptionist.synopsis: Receptionist at the entrance of the Hospital. She's mostly supposed to be there for flavor and to provide directions to the operating room (down the hallway and under the observation area.) If you piss her off or try to circumvent her to see the doctor, she'll fight you.
Reception_Receptionist.how_to_trigger: Go to the hospital in the town in SCL. Speak to the nurse at the reception area.S_TWN_Hospital_Reception_Receptionist pos:-204; 31; -6

ZealousAssistant_001.synopsis: One of the nurses in the Hospital
ZealousAssistant_001.how_to_trigger: Convince the Surgeon to be operated by the nurses. Talk to them after.

ZealousAssistant_003.synopsis: One of the nurses in the Hospital
ZealousAssistant_003.how_to_trigger: Convince the Surgeon to be operated by the nurses. Talk to them after.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD.synopsis: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.

Surgeon.synopsis: Surgeon in the Cursed Town. In the ruins of a hospital, a twisted, monstrous surgeon - corrupted by the shadowcurse around him - is operating on a human strapped to a reclining chair. The operation is essentially torture, with the surgeon stripping away the human's senses (eyes, tongue have been removed), but the surgeon believes he's doing what he needs to to help his 'patient'.
Surgeon.how_to_trigger: Enter the cursed Town beside Moonrise. Enter the Hospital. Approach the surgeon in the operating theatre (large round room at the back.)

Patient.synopsis: Patient of the surgeon. Eyes, tongue have been removed.
Patient.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_Agoto -199; 27; 44Use "Attack" button in the dialog and kill the surgeon and the nurses.Talk to the patient.

Patient_AD.synopsis: Patiens has no tongue or eyes. If you release him he produces some sounds, walks a couple of feet and dies from blood loss.
Patient_AD.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_Agoto -199; 27; 44Use "Attack" button in the dialog and kill the surgeon and the nurses.Talk to the patient.

PAD_SurgeonDead.synopsis: PAD is played after Surgeon is dead.Variations: - Killed by Nurses; - Killed himself; - Killed in combat;
PAD_SurgeonDead.how_to_trigger: oe debugbookGo To Region - Act 2 - TWN - HospitalEnter the hospital, find and kill SurgeonYour character will play this PAD.

PAD_Entrance_2P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Hospital in SCL.Version for 2 characters.
PAD_Entrance_2P.how_to_trigger: Approach the Hospital in SCL with 2 characters

ZealousAssistant_002.synopsis: One of the nurses in the HospitalMUTE (maybe just can't talk or maybe lost her tongue to the surgeon)
ZealousAssistant_002.how_to_trigger: Convince the Surgeon to be operated by the nurses. Talk to them after.

Reception_CorpseTender_16.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_16.text: I'll do better, and the patients will be better, and it will all be fine...

Reception_CorpseTender_23.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_23.text: The doctor's teachings live on. I will be fine, the patients will be fine, everything fine.

Reception_CorpseTender_46.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_46.text: Don't call the doctor yet! I've got potions, sutures - I know I can do this...
Reception_CorpseTender_46.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't see you coming, but from the sound of your footsteps thinks you might be the doctor. NodeContext: The nurse is panicking assuming you are a patient

Reception_CorpseTender_72.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_72.text: Oh, you're a patient. This is the children's ward - triage is back that way.
Reception_CorpseTender_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices you. NodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices the player.

Reception_CorpseTender_28.speaker: Lae'zel
Reception_CorpseTender_28.text: See that corpse? Arabella's father, in the oh-so-decaying flesh.

Reception_CorpseTender_62.speaker: Shadowheart
Reception_CorpseTender_62.text: That's Arabella's father - or was Arabella's father.
Reception_CorpseTender_62.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

Reception_CorpseTender_22.speaker: Karlach
Reception_CorpseTender_22.text: That body she's working on - that's Arabella's father.

Reception_CorpseTender_42.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_42.text: Why are you treating a dead body?

Reception_CorpseTender_66.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_66.text: Not dead, merely medicated. To ease the pain.
Reception_CorpseTender_66.context: NodeContext: indignant, but quick to regain professional composure

Reception_CorpseTender_5.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_5.text: The patient's definitely dead. Been dead for a while, judging by the smell.

Reception_CorpseTender_76.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_76.text: The patient is asleep. The sedative is quite strong, you see.

Reception_CorpseTender_0.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_0.text: Give the corpse a subtle poke.

Reception_CorpseTender_17.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_17.text: Hey! Don't do that to my patient!
Reception_CorpseTender_17.context: InternalNodeContext: The nurse reacts to the player giving the corpse a poke.

Reception_CorpseTender_60.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_60.text: I see movement! The patient's awake! Hello, can you hear me?
Reception_CorpseTender_60.context: InternalNodeContext: The nurse thinks the hand movement is a sign that the patient is waking up (he's not), and addresses him.NodeContext: overjoyed, grateful

Reception_CorpseTender_32.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_32.text: Now that that's sorted, might I purchase some supplies?

Reception_CorpseTender_83.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_83.text: Still not feeling better? Let's see if I can help you.

Reception_CorpseTender_26.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_26.text: Not much left now, but you're welcome to look.

Reception_CorpseTender_21.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_21.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to tend to my patient.

Reception_CorpseTender_70.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_70.text: I know this stillness - his body is simply conserving energy as he heals. The patient is stable.

Reception_CorpseTender_27.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_27.text: I sense the patient's soul - he is merely resting while his body heals.

Reception_CorpseTender_29.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_29.text: I see now - they're sleeping peacefully. I think your work here is already done.

Reception_CorpseTender_82.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_82.text: Yes, yes! I knew these hands would not fail me. The patient is sure to recover.

Reception_CorpseTender_39.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_39.text: Now I must ask you to step away. This patient demands my utmost attention.

Reception_CorpseTender_58.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_58.text: Ah, you've induced such a peaceful sleep. Your knowledge of herbs is impressive - the doctor would be proud.

Reception_CorpseTender_7.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_7.text: I see you have medical supplies on hand. Can you spare any?

Reception_CorpseTender_13.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_13.text: I will sell you what I can once I've stabilised the patient.

Reception_CorpseTender_10.speaker: Player
Reception_CorpseTender_10.text: Actually, the doctor requested my presence - I'm a master of natural remedy.

Reception_CorpseTender_4.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_4.text: Most unorthodox. But I am not one to question the doctor's methods... Do you need something of me?

Reception_CorpseTender_8.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_8.text: You must be mistaken - the doctor would have informed us of such an arrangement.

Reception_CorpseTender_73.speaker: Astarion
Reception_CorpseTender_73.text: Is that Arabella's father she's tending? Our little idol thief has some terrible luck.
Reception_CorpseTender_73.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

Reception_CorpseTender_38.speaker: Wyll
Reception_CorpseTender_38.text: Ugh - I know that corpse. Arabella's father's met a most unpleasant end.

Reception_CorpseTender_67.speaker: Gale
Reception_CorpseTender_67.text: This corpse... It's Arabella's father. The horror of his end I daren't contemplate.

Reception_CorpseTender_37.speaker: Narrator
Reception_CorpseTender_37.text: *You recognise the corpse being tended - the girl Arabella's father.*
Reception_CorpseTender_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

Reception_CorpseTender_49.speaker: Lae'zel
Reception_CorpseTender_49.text: See that corpse? Arabella's mother, in the oh-so-decaying flesh.

Reception_CorpseTender_30.speaker: Shadowheart
Reception_CorpseTender_30.text: That's Arabella's mother - or was Arabella's mother.
Reception_CorpseTender_30.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

Reception_CorpseTender_52.speaker: Karlach
Reception_CorpseTender_52.text: That body - it looks like Arabella's mother.

Reception_CorpseTender_6.speaker: Astarion
Reception_CorpseTender_6.text: Is that Arabella's mother she's tending? Our little idol thief has some terrible luck.
Reception_CorpseTender_6.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

Reception_CorpseTender_63.speaker: Wyll
Reception_CorpseTender_63.text: Ugh - I know that corpse. Arabella's mother's met a most unpleasant end.

Reception_CorpseTender_78.speaker: Gale
Reception_CorpseTender_78.text: This corpse... It's Arabella's mother. The horror of her end I daren't contemplate.

Reception_CorpseTender_80.speaker: Narrator
Reception_CorpseTender_80.text: *You recognise the corpse being tended - the girl Arabella's mother.*
Reception_CorpseTender_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

Reception_CorpseTender_55.speaker: Lae'zel
Reception_CorpseTender_55.text: Must be Arabella's father. What's left of him, anyway.

Reception_CorpseTender_24.speaker: Shadowheart
Reception_CorpseTender_24.text: A tiefling. That's Arabella's father, I wager - or was Arabella's father.
Reception_CorpseTender_24.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

Reception_CorpseTender_36.speaker: Karlach
Reception_CorpseTender_36.text: That body she's tending must be Arabella's father.

Reception_CorpseTender_14.speaker: Astarion
Reception_CorpseTender_14.text: A tiefling corpse - odds are that's sweet Arabella's father.
Reception_CorpseTender_14.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

Reception_CorpseTender_19.speaker: Wyll
Reception_CorpseTender_19.text: That tiefling's seen better days. Arabella's father, I wager.

Reception_CorpseTender_64.speaker: Gale
Reception_CorpseTender_64.text: A dead tiefling. Arabella's father, no doubt. The horror of his end I daren't contemplate.

Reception_CorpseTender_57.speaker: Narrator
Reception_CorpseTender_57.text: *The corpse is a tiefling man - the girl Arabella's father, presumably.*
Reception_CorpseTender_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

Reception_CorpseTender_56.speaker: Lae'zel
Reception_CorpseTender_56.text: A tiefling. Must be Arabella's mother. What's left of her, anyway.

Reception_CorpseTender_11.speaker: Shadowheart
Reception_CorpseTender_11.text: A tiefling. That's Arabella's mother, I wager - or was Arabella's mother.
Reception_CorpseTender_11.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

Reception_CorpseTender_51.speaker: Karlach
Reception_CorpseTender_51.text: That corpse she's tending must be Arabella's mother.

Reception_CorpseTender_47.speaker: Astarion
Reception_CorpseTender_47.text: A tiefling corpse - odds are that's sweet Arabella's mother.
Reception_CorpseTender_47.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

Reception_CorpseTender_65.speaker: Wyll
Reception_CorpseTender_65.text: That tiefling's seen better days. Arabella's mother, I wager.

Reception_CorpseTender_45.speaker: Gale
Reception_CorpseTender_45.text: A dead tiefling. Arabella's mother, no doubt. The horror of her end I daren't contemplate.

Reception_CorpseTender_81.speaker: Narrator
Reception_CorpseTender_81.text: *The corpse is a tiefling woman - the girl Arabella's mother, presumably.*
Reception_CorpseTender_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

Reception_CorpseTender_12.speaker: Narrator
Reception_CorpseTender_12.text: *Her patient is a tiefling - one you don't recognise, though clearly long dead.*
Reception_CorpseTender_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

Reception_CorpseTender_77.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender_77.text: The doctor's found oblivion... well. No time to mourn. I'll fix this without him.

AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat_0.text: Behold - the leech, for draining humours most foul.

AD_ResponseToSurgeon_000_Combat_0.speaker: Sister Hunna
AD_ResponseToSurgeon_000_Combat_0.text: The master surgeon's will is my honour.

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_0.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_0.text: He is absent. Abscence is him.
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_1.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_1.text: Scalpel. First cut. Make the cut.
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_1.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense.

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_2.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_5.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_5.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_6.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_6.text: I am master. I am master?
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_6.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_7.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

ZealousAssistant_001_AD_11.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD_11.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

AD_Surgeon_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_0.text: Only with unwavering hand can we show our subject mercy.
AD_Surgeon_0.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_1.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_1.text: See here, how I soothe each vein with the tenderest touch.
AD_Surgeon_1.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_2.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_2.text: Woe, that every subject cannot know the peace of absence.

AD_Surgeon_3.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_3.text: What is a healer with no patient to tend?

AD_Surgeon_4.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_4.text: Witness the solace of the Lady's whispers with each slice.
AD_Surgeon_4.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_5.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_5.text: Only in absence is one healed.

AD_Surgeon_6.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_6.text: Would that the sisters' incisions were soothing as mine.

AD_Surgeon_7.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_7.text: Your eyes are sharp, sisters. Tend to your scalpels, so I might say the same of them.
AD_Surgeon_7.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat_0.text: Still yourself. The saw's teeth will open the way for her shadow.

PAD_Entrance_1P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P_0.text: A house of healing, for all the good it does anyone now.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat_.speaker: Sister Anya
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat_.context: NodeContext: 'Sister?' = expectantly, asking for his next surgical tool.

ZealousAssistant_000_0.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_0.text: The great cure. Final, final. Forever.
ZealousAssistant_000_0.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

ZealousAssistant_000_1.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_1.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

ZealousAssistant_000_2.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_2.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

ZealousAssistant_000_AD_0.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_AD_0.text: The gift of... nothing. Her gift.
ZealousAssistant_000_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

ZealousAssistant_000_AD_1.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_AD_1.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

ZealousAssistant_000_AD_11.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_AD_11.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

Reception_Receptionist_9.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_9.text: The doctor is absent today. Come back another time.

Reception_Receptionist_36.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_36.text: The doctor will see you now.

Reception_Receptionist_49.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_49.text: Down the corridor. Down to theatre you go.

Reception_Receptionist_73.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_73.text: You're not sick, not sick at all. Wait in line.

Reception_Receptionist_86.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_86.text: No worse, no better, no need to be here.

Reception_Receptionist_88.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_88.text: Here to see the doctor? Are we poorly? Are we desperately poorly?

Reception_Receptionist_55.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_55.text: Not so well. But well enough to wait. Join the line, and you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nurse 'looks' you over, assessing your condition.InternalNodeContext: Upon investigation, deduces that you're not that sick.

Reception_Receptionist_79.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_79.text: I'm sick as a dog - dark compulsions addle my mind.

Reception_Receptionist_51.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_51.text: Hrm, hrm. Let me check, let me check.

Reception_Receptionist_40.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_40.text: I'm only truly happy when I'm ending someone's life.

Reception_Receptionist_69.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_69.text: There is no shame in an end. All things come to be lost. But if you wish to be examined...

Reception_Receptionist_11.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_11.text: Join the line - you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist_11.context: NodeContext: with a touch of desperation

Reception_Receptionist_28.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_28.text: My mind is full of holes, and some of them are still being punched.

Reception_Receptionist_5.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_5.text: Poor dear. Poor, poor dear. Who did this to you?
Reception_Receptionist_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nuse checking the DU's head

Reception_Receptionist_60.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_60.text: What in the Hells can you see?

Reception_Receptionist_21.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_21.text: I am but a nurse here, the Surgeon... he will be able to examine you in full.

Reception_Receptionist_61.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_61.text: Everything. I lose control of myself, and kill without command.

Reception_Receptionist_92.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_92.text: A unique disease - one which has never passed through this institution before.

Reception_Receptionist_63.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_63.text: The Surgeon will be most interested in you.

Reception_Receptionist_94.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_94.text: When I try to sleep I am plagued by distressing sights.

Reception_Receptionist_77.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_77.text: Too many thoughts - a thrice-cursed ailment. The emptiness you yearn for will be yours again.

Reception_Receptionist_66.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_66.text: Fine fine. I'll get in line.

Reception_Receptionist_95.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_95.text: I don't have time to wait - I need to see the doctor right now.

Reception_Receptionist_14.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_14.text: Yes yes, but all must wait. The doctor's hands are full.

Reception_Receptionist_43.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_43.text: Join the line - you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist_43.context: NodeContext: with a touch of desperation

Reception_Receptionist_19.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_19.text: I'm not a patient - I've been hired as a new healer.

Reception_Receptionist_56.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_56.text: I am no patient - I've been hired as a spiritual advisor.

Reception_Receptionist_93.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_93.text: I am no patient - I've just been hired as an expert in maladaptive necromantic malaise.

Reception_Receptionist_81.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_81.text: I'm not a patient - I'm the doctor's new assistant.

Reception_Receptionist_24.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_24.text: Such cruelty, such callousness. And in our time of need. Away.

Reception_Receptionist_18.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_18.text: Mimic the symptoms of Assassin's Blood, a well-known poison.

Reception_Receptionist_27.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_27.text: Feign the symptoms of a disease most terrible.

Reception_Receptionist_41.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_41.text: Poor creature - so sad, so sick.

Reception_Receptionist_31.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_31.text: The doctor will see you. The doctor will soothe.

Reception_Receptionist_10.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_10.text: Down to the theatre, be swift, be saved.

Reception_Receptionist_34.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Disgusted reaction to player's pretend illness.

Reception_Receptionist_35.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_35.text: Plague! Pest! In line, or leave.

Reception_Receptionist_23.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_23.text: Enough of this - I'm going in.

Reception_Receptionist_72.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_72.text: Fine, fine. I'll get back in line.

Reception_Receptionist_68.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_68.text: Wait! My wounds may not be visible on the outside, but I still need help.

Reception_Receptionist_91.speaker: Narrator
Reception_Receptionist_91.text: *There's a hint of recognition in her eyes as she studies you.*
Reception_Receptionist_91.context: InternalNodeContext: The receptionist recognises that you're referring to your mental health.

Reception_Receptionist_29.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_29.text: The unseen wounds of war - the doctor's hand will close them.

Reception_Receptionist_50.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_50.text: Every monster you can imagine, man or beast, has tried to kill me. I should really see the doctor.

Reception_Receptionist_75.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_75.text: You can let me in or I can burn, electrify, or freeze this place - maybe even all three. Your choice.

Reception_Receptionist_90.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_90.text: A most impatient patient... Very well. Still your cries, restless soul.

Reception_Receptionist_16.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_16.text: Quiet! Quiet! Everyone must wait their turn, wait in line... Doctor's orders.

Reception_Receptionist_1.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_1.text: I've picked up a diabolic disease - the symptoms are quite hellish.

Reception_Receptionist_22.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_22.text: My dear lady - look at my complexion. I am at death's door.

Reception_Receptionist_65.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_65.text: As pale as a ghost. You must see the doctor immediately.
Reception_Receptionist_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: shocked reaction to Astarion's palenessNodeContext: shocked reaction -the patient is pale as a ghost

Reception_Receptionist_12.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist_12.text: No thanks, I'll take my chances out there.

Reception_Receptionist_71.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nurse 'looks' you over, assessing your condition.

ZealousAssistant_001_0.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_0.text: Master. No, no. Not master. Not.
ZealousAssistant_001_0.context: NodeContext: In weird clipped syllables and barks. Not loud, just tense

ZealousAssistant_001_1.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_1.text: Cured. Be cured, he cured, we cured.
ZealousAssistant_001_1.context: NodeContext: In weird clipped syllables and barks. Not loud, just tense

ZealousAssistant_001_2.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_2.context: NodeContext: In weird clipped syllables and barks. Not loud, just tense

ZealousAssistant_003_0.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_0.text: Be still darling. Let Sister Anya comfort you.

ZealousAssistant_003_1.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_1.text: Dear child, what is the matter? No one can hurt you here.

ZealousAssistant_003_2.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_2.text: Calm yourself, darling. I'm here to help.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_0.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_0.text: Can you feel it? The hurting?

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_9.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_9.text: Here, darling. Let me soothe the pain.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_1.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_1.text: Come closer, child. Let me help you.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_2.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_2.text: Come to me, darling. Where does it hurt?

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_3.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_3.text: Bring me your sick, your lonely. In these hands, they are safe.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_4.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_4.text: Dear me, child - no need to carry on.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_5.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_5.text: Sleep, my child. It will be better when you wake.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_6.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_6.text: Show me where it stings, little one.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_7.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_7.text: It will sting for just a moment, kitten. I promise.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_8.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_8.text: Hush, little one. Dry your tears.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD_10.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD_10.text: Come children, one and all. Come, and know peace.

AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat_0.text: Blood has pooled in the brain. I must open the cranium!

Surgeon_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon stand by a table upon which a wriggling human lies strapped down in an X position. Several Darkcloak sisters stand by, each with a scalpel in hand. The surgeon’s voice is very gentle - the voice of a father explaining something to his young child.

Surgeon_130.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_130.text: The objective of the scalpel, sisters, is to soothe, for the scalpel, indeed, is an extension of Shar.
Surgeon_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The bewildered human thrashes against its restraints to no avail as the Surgeon speaks. He is holding his scalpel-like fingers high like a sacred object.

Surgeon_73.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_73.text: See how the patient reacts when I but stroke the right nerve. Hear its comfort. Hear the very melody of mercy.
Surgeon_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon inserts his scalpel-finger into a nerve cluster in the human’s shoulder. Flesh parts and blood gushes. The screams of the human are so loud they nearly drown out the Surgeon’s words.

Surgeon_163.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_163.text: Pray, sister, show us the extent of your beneficence.
Surgeon_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) With his free hand he very gently invites one of the Darkcloak sisters to cut into the human.

Surgeon_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sister approaches - she looks uncertain of herself. She cuts into the human’s belly, but it’s a superficial and hesitant incision. The humann clenches its teeth and hisses in pain, but nothing like when the Surgeon applied his scalpel-finger.

Surgeon_144.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_144.text: Stop. Stay your hand, for it slaps where it should stroke. We can hardly hear the patient's sighs of solace.
Surgeon_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Though the surgeon admonishes the Darkcloak sister, he does so in the same, gentle tone. There is no anger here, only paternal instruction. As he speaks, the Darkcloak sister bows her head in shame and takes a step back.

Surgeon_30.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_30.text: Perhaps it is our unexpected audience that makes you quiver.
Surgeon_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon now looks straight at us, perfectly aware of our presence all this time. He points in our direction with his scalpel-finger and as he does so, all attending Darkcloak sister turn to us as well. It is a menacing sight.

Surgeon_141.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_141.text: Come. Step forward. You are no sister, but that matters none. Every student is welcome.

Surgeon_81.speaker: Player
Surgeon_81.text: I don't wish to study, only to lift the curse on this land.

Surgeon_115.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_115.text: A curse? Nay, a cure that leads to the very pinnacle of being:

Surgeon_52.speaker: Player
Surgeon_52.text: A student, yes. Do please enlighten me.

Surgeon_14.speaker: Player
Surgeon_14.text: You will stop this sick spectacle at once.

Surgeon_82.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_82.text: Sick. Quite. But on the cusp of a cure:

Surgeon_176.speaker: Player
Surgeon_176.text: I am no student, I seek knowledge of the curse. It is a blight on this land.

Surgeon_127.speaker: Player
Surgeon_127.text: I am a scholar, this is true - just not in the study of torture.

Surgeon_80.speaker: Player
Surgeon_80.text: What wrong has this man done to deserve such torture?

Surgeon_10.speaker: Player
Surgeon_10.text: In my experience, torture is usually more pain and less proselytising.

Surgeon_4.speaker: Player
Surgeon_4.text: Just kill them already - all this torture is pointless.

Surgeon_168.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_168.text: Behold, sisters, the very face of ignorance - one who mistakes tenderness for torture.

Surgeon_114.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_114.text: Go on. Acquaint the face of ignorance with the true object of our studies.

Surgeon_133.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_133.text: Come. Step forward. I can see the love of Shar darken your eyes. Be welcome.

Surgeon_108.speaker: Player
Surgeon_108.text: May Shar guide your blessing hands.

Surgeon_48.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_48.text: And the rough vessels that are yours.

Surgeon_41.speaker: Player
Surgeon_41.text: What lesson are you teaching these sisters?

Surgeon_129.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_129.text: Tell me, what is the guiding principle of the goddess?

Surgeon_136.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_136.text: I profess there is another more profound.

Surgeon_84.speaker: Sister Hunna
Surgeon_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

Surgeon_135.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_135.text: Absence. No other word captures the heart of Shar so very perfectly.

Surgeon_55.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_55.text: It is the scalpel-led journey that leads from pain to peace.
Surgeon_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On the words ‘pain’ and ‘peace’ he stabs the patient hard in each eye with his blade-finger, blinding it. It utters bloodcurdling screams.

Surgeon_70.speaker: Lae'zel
Surgeon_70.text: Only a beast of a man toys with his victim. Entertaining, if not efficient.

Surgeon_100.speaker: Shadowheart
Surgeon_100.text: A stinging truth - but a truth nonetheless.
Surgeon_100.context: NodeContext: Agreeable, as if listening to sage wisdom

Surgeon_62.speaker: Karlach
Surgeon_62.text: What the fuck is this loon talking about.
Surgeon_62.context: NodeContext: In mild wonder cause the thing she's reacting to is very outlandish.

Surgeon_37.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_37.text: See? What is the light of eyes but the cancer that causes one to witness the laceration of being?

Surgeon_17.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_17.text: If light is the symptom, then darkness is the cure, for in light there is presence, but in darkness there is absence.

Surgeon_47.speaker: Sister Hunna
Surgeon_47.text: In light is presence; in darkness, absence.
Surgeon_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

Surgeon_53.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_53.text: You are well on your way. But one white orb disfigures you still. Let us finish the cure.
Surgeon_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) They are all poised to strike.

Surgeon_44.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_44.text: But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes you. See how painfully present you remain...

Surgeon_140.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_140.text: We do not wish to see you suffer so. Let us cure you.

Surgeon_7.speaker: Player
Surgeon_7.text: Your subject is tainted. Shar's succour must only be granted to the willing.

Surgeon_94.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_94.text: Hmmm. 'Only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.' You know her teachings well.

Surgeon_71.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_71.text: And yet, these sisters must exercise their gifts, for the art of absence lies in its execution.

Surgeon_119.speaker: Player
Surgeon_119.text: The sisters require a willing volunteer, a master of the art.

Surgeon_85.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_85.text: And how gracious of you, master, to tender your own flesh.

Surgeon_67.speaker: Player
Surgeon_67.text: There is no greater joy than watching a master at work. You are their teacher - who better to volunteer?

Surgeon_149.speaker: Player
Surgeon_149.text: Their blades are uneven. Efficient surgery will require further training.

Surgeon_120.speaker: Player
Surgeon_120.text: Examine the sisters and their implements.

Surgeon_56.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_56.text: *The sisters' blades are bloodied and dull. Only the most measured hand could make a clean incision.*
Surgeon_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

Surgeon_164.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_164.text: *You note nothing unusual about the sisters, aside from their menace.*
Surgeon_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a nearby sister. She remains still, oblivious to your inspection.

Surgeon_39.speaker: Player
Surgeon_39.text: Cast your gaze over the blades of the sisters.

Surgeon_77.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_77.text: *The sisters' blades are unkempt, rusted with blood. Even in your skilled hands, a clean cut would be difficult.*

Surgeon_32.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_32.text: *Although you're well acquainted with most blades - implements of medicine aren't really your speciality.*

Surgeon_177.speaker: Player
Surgeon_177.text: Recall what you know of Shar's teachings.

Surgeon_104.speaker: Player
Surgeon_104.text: Recall what you know of Shar's blasphemous teachings.

Surgeon_123.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_123.text: *You remember a Sharran maxim: 'Go forth and sow doubt, but do not compel it - for only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.'*

Surgeon_54.speaker: Narrator
Surgeon_54.text: *Try as you might, you can't think of any relevant teachings.*

Surgeon_64.speaker: Player
Surgeon_64.text: The sisters aren't ready. They'll make me sick instead of curing me.

Surgeon_181.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_181.text: Hush. Fret not so. You are quite ready, aren't you, sisters?

Surgeon_12.speaker: Player
Surgeon_12.text: The goddess has greater plans for me than to submit to your scalpels.

Surgeon_145.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_145.text: Another absence is your fate? But if you are not here to be cured, how will my sisters learn?

Surgeon_153.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_153.text: Their incisions are, as yet, still streaked with imprecision - that much I must concede.

Surgeon_68.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_68.text: How to steady their hands, I wonder.

Surgeon_112.speaker: Player
Surgeon_112.text: I have read your treatise. Initiate the final lesson, or die by my hand.

Surgeon_69.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_69.text: The final lesson. Yes. For to teach absence, one must become absent.

Surgeon_139.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_139.text: Oh, but the final lesson is hardly at hand. Would you deny my sisters the full breadth of my teachings?

Surgeon_31.speaker: Player
Surgeon_31.text: 'Only with sacrifice is mastery gained.' For the sisters to learn, you must submit.

Surgeon_142.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_142.text: Yes. Submit I must, into the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.

Surgeon_27.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_27.text: I rather think your sacrifice will be quite masterful enough for our purposes.

Surgeon_103.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_103.text: Sisters. Speak the truth that I have taught you.
Surgeon_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

Surgeon_63.speaker: Player
Surgeon_63.text: Sparring is vital to progress. Have them practice on each other.

Surgeon_134.speaker: Player
Surgeon_134.text: Practice - that's how I got good with a blade. They should spar each other.

Surgeon_138.speaker: Player
Surgeon_138.text: In my years of study, I have found no better teacher than example. Perhaps you could volunteer?

Surgeon_97.speaker: Player
Surgeon_97.text: When the fist trembles, sometimes another is needed to steady it. A good master would volunteer themselves.

Surgeon_46.speaker: Player
Surgeon_46.text: I take joy in performing with a master of my craft - I'm sure the sisters are the same. Why don't you volunteer?

Surgeon_58.speaker: Player
Surgeon_58.text: They need a better subject to practise on first. Not a student, but a master.

Surgeon_116.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_116.text: I see now. By example I must edify and quell the light that blinds us.

Surgeon_125.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

Surgeon_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) En masse, the sisters fall on the Surgeon like the senators on Caesar. They stab and keep stabbing the Surgeon with their scalpels until there’s nothing left but a bloody mess. After it’s over, the sisters stay in place to perform a Sharran prayer. They’ve no regard for us - we’ve dealt with the Surgeon without having to combat him.

Surgeon_122.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_122.text: What say you to the master, sisters?

Surgeon_60.speaker: Sister Hunna
Surgeon_60.text: The scalpel soothes. Come sing its song. We would hear your melody of mercy.
Surgeon_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

Surgeon_40.speaker: Player
Surgeon_40.text: Why not have them hone their skills on each other?

Surgeon_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_0.text: Yes... For are we not all in need of a cure?

Surgeon_148.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_148.text: The scalpel does not discriminate. Let each and every one of you partake in its soothing journey.

Surgeon_57.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

Surgeon_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Screaming and slashing, the sisters brutally murder each other.

Surgeon_113.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_113.text: It is a proud moment when one sees one's teachings so lovingly taken to heart.

Surgeon_33.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_33.text: You are to be commended for their graduation - rewarded with the promised cure.

Surgeon_132.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_132.text: Come, I will acquaint you with the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.
Surgeon_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He holds up his scalpel hand menacingly, clearly poised to strike at us.

Surgeon_118.speaker: Player
Surgeon_118.text: I am not worthy! Please, show me how a master works - I would be honoured.

Surgeon_13.speaker: Player
Surgeon_13.text: You do me an honour, but I am not worthy. Show me the way of Shar - I beg of you.

Surgeon_59.speaker: Player
Surgeon_59.text: I am but a fumbling squire before a master swordsman. Please, demonstrate so that I might learn.

Surgeon_50.speaker: Player
Surgeon_50.text: My magic has blinded me - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.

Surgeon_74.speaker: Player
Surgeon_74.text: I sought purpose in the natural world - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.

Surgeon_105.speaker: Player
Surgeon_105.text: I would rather acquaint myself - if you show me how.

Surgeon_1.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_1.text: Your diligence is exemplary. Very well: your own scalpel you will be.

Surgeon_38.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_38.text: Observe - then succeed me, into the succour of Shar.

Surgeon_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

Surgeon_146.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_146.text: Oh but hush. Hold still. Let there be an end to your suffering.

Surgeon_6.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_6.text: There is misdirection in your words. You seek to linger in your sickness.

Surgeon_90.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_90.text: Sisters, what say we to such wretches?

Surgeon_91.speaker: Player
Surgeon_91.text: I suffer from boredom. The cure is ripping you apart.

Surgeon_75.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_75.text: How your sickness misdirects you! Blinded by luminous eyes. What say you to this, dear sisters?

Surgeon_99.speaker: Player
Surgeon_99.text: You are the cause of the only suffering here - I am duty-bound to end you.

Surgeon_49.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_49.text: But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes even you, one who walks faithfully in her shadow. See how painfully present you remain...

Surgeon_158.speaker: Astarion
Surgeon_158.text: He's just like Cazador - utterly insane.

Surgeon_92.speaker: Wyll
Surgeon_92.text: Hells. Only a monster would inflict misery and call it medicine.

Surgeon_126.speaker: Gale
Surgeon_126.text: Gods, what living nightmare is this?

Surgeon_171.speaker: Player
Surgeon_171.text: I confess I'm unfamiliar with the ritual you're practising.

Surgeon_151.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_151.text: I will make you intimately familiar.

Surgeon_3.speaker: Player
Surgeon_3.text: You teach Shar's ways with grace, for such an... altered being.

Surgeon_131.speaker: Malus Thorm
Surgeon_131.text: Not altered, sister - elevated. Long have I basked in Shar's embrace. A vessel of her will I have become.

AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat_0.text: A successful procedure, Shar be praised!

Patient_AD_0.speaker: Distressed Patient
Patient_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Gurgling - tongue has been torn out

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat_.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat_.text: Sister. The first instrument, if I may.

RooftopRaven_5.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_5.text: |I explicitly told you to leave and I'm not interested in what you have to say|

RooftopRaven_30.speaker: Narrator
RooftopRaven_30.text: |*The raven is unnerved by your presence and clearly wants you to leave*|

RooftopRaven_1.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_1.text: |*Calm raven down with your im-peck-able animal handling techniques*|

RooftopRaven_28.speaker: Narrator
RooftopRaven_28.text: |*Hard to say whether raven was impressed by your skillcheck or a pun, but it isn't threatened by you anymore*|

RooftopRaven_39.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_39.text: |*That didn't work and raven seems upset and agressive now*|

RooftopRaven_41.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_41.text: |*Notice all the cool stuff raven gathered and complinet its scavenging squills*|

RooftopRaven_15.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_15.text: |*Just prepare to fight raven for no good reason*|

RooftopRaven_42.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_42.text: |*Raven is still concerned but not hostile*|

RooftopRaven_31.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_31.text: |*Raven is calmed down and unconcerned with you being around*|

RooftopRaven_36.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_36.text: |H... Hi? What are you doing at my home?|

RooftopRaven_21.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_21.text: |This literally is just a rooftop though? I just stumbled into you|

RooftopRaven_7.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_7.text: |Yeah. But I still live here. And you're invading on my living space|

RooftopRaven_17.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_17.text: |Actually, I just wanted your feedback on my stand up routine? It goes something like that...|

RooftopRaven_52.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_52.text: |Sure, you do seem like a nice enough person. Consider yourself my guest, but nothing more|

RooftopRaven_3.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_3.text: |Well, okay, most of the time I just scavenge the area.|

RooftopRaven_27.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_27.text: |Lately there has been an influx of those cultists - provide quite a nice food source. Not much else to say|

RooftopRaven_35.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_35.text: |Can I have those very cool ingredients?|

RooftopRaven_13.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_13.text: |Your jokes suck and so do you. Leave my home now|

RooftopRaven_60.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_60.text: |Oh, I see there are some cool ingredients you have lying around? I'd really like to discuss those!|

RooftopRaven_14.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_14.text: |Oh, you noticed! Yeah, it was quite a hassle to get them!|

RooftopRaven_47.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_47.text: |Those are MINE! Don't come any closer to them!|

RooftopRaven_53.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_53.text: |I'm not gonna take orders from a harpy *attack*|

RooftopRaven_6.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_6.text: |Oh, I'm sorry, I did't realize. I'll take my leave now.|

RooftopRaven_56.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven_56.text: |I'm not gonna take orders from a harpy *attack*|

RooftopRaven_50.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven_50.text: |We haven't talked yet, but your friends seem nice enough to let you hang around|

PAD_SurgeonDead_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SurgeonDead_1.text: I can't believe that worked. These shadows really do twist people.

PAD_SurgeonDead_2.speaker: Player
PAD_SurgeonDead_2.text: I didn't think that would work. This shadow curse is something else.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat_.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat_.text: This flesh must be flayed. The next instrument, sister.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat_.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat_.text: The subject resists. Next instrument, good sister.

AD_Surgeon_Syringe_Combat_0.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Syringe_Combat_0.text: A sure remedy for a sickened mind.

PAD_Entrance_2P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_0.text: A house of healing, from the looks of it.

PAD_Entrance_2P_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_1.text: Good news for us. There could be some useful potions inside.

ZealousAssistant_002_1.speaker: Narrator
ZealousAssistant_002_1.text: *The nurse has nothing to say - or, perhaps, can say nothing at all.*

ZealousAssistant_002_2.speaker: Narrator
ZealousAssistant_002_2.text: *The nurse regards you, then disregards you.*
